chief_complaint: Painful sores involving private parts for 7 days.
history_of_present_illness: Had unprotected sex with a commercial sex worker 2 weeks ago.
exposure_and_epidemiology: Resides in The Gambia, recent unprotected sexual contact with commercial sex worker.
physical_exam: Well nourished, in considerable pain, difficulty walking due to sores. Numerous painful ulcers on penis, scrotum and inner thigh, tender, soft, bleed on contact. No inguinal lymphadenopathy. General examination unremarkable.
differential_diagnosis: Herpes simplex, syphilis, chancroid. Herpes ulcers self-limiting in immunocompetent, severe in immunocompromised. Syphilis ulcers usually painless, single, painless adenopathy. Chancroid ulcers multiple, painful, painful adenopathy in 50%. Clinical diagnosis unreliable.
management_and_clinical_course: Treat syndromically for syphilis with single dose IM benzathine penicillin 2.4 million units, for chancroid with single dose azithromycin 1g PO or ciprofloxacin 500mg bid for 3 days or erythromycin 500mg qds for 7 days. If HIV-positive, add aciclovir 400mg tds for 7 days. Test for HIV and start antiretroviral treatment if positive. Serology for syphilis to guide treatment for future contacts.
